etymology.description: 下(下) (xià, "below; under") and 午(午) (wǔ, "noon") combine to form 下午(下午) (xiàwǔ, "afternoon"). This combination represents the time period "below" or following "noon." In this context, 下(下) (xià, "below; under") indicates the period of time after noon has passed.
etymology.interpretation: The word 下午(下午) indicates the time period that follows noon, representing the afternoon as the part of the day after the sun has reached its highest point.

examples.chinese: 下午两点开会(下午兩點開會)。
examples.english: Meeting at two in the afternoon.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢在下午读书(我喜歡在下午讀書)。
examples.english: I like reading in the afternoon.

examples.chinese: 下午茶时间到了(下午茶時間到了)。
examples.english: It's tea time in the afternoon.
